title.descriptions:
The title of the ontology as given by its authors or by the documenting person.

Examples: `UFO-S`, `Common Ontology of Value and Risk`, `Music Ontology Refactored`

oneOf.descriptions:
The year of the first publication of the ontology.

Example: `2014`

The year of the most recent publication of the ontology, if different from `creation-year`.

Example: `2018`

domain.descriptions:
The list of domains covered in the ontology.

Examples: `services`, `value`, `risk`, `music`.

oneOf.descriptions:
Notes on the ontology documentation process.

Example: `Ontology was originally designed in Portuguese`.

types.descriptions:
The list of types that apply to the ontology, either claimed by the authors or assessed by the documenting person.

Examples: `core`, `domain`, `application`.

language.descriptions:
The language in which the labels of the ontology are written. This field should use IANA's standard for language tags, which are listed here: https://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry/language-subtag-registry

Examples: `en` for English, `pt-br` for Brazilian Portuguese.

oneOf.descriptions:
The list of goals that motivated the development of the ontology.

Examples: `conceptual clarification`, `database design`, `api design`, `interoperability`.

The list of contexts in which the ontology was developed represented as an array.

Examples: `research`, `industry`, `classroom`.

The BibTex id of the main source publication for the ontology, which should be available in `references.bib`; use only a single source per folder giving preference for documenting the latest version of the model.

Examples: `nardi2015commitment`.

style.descriptions:
The list of representation styles adopted in the ontology.

Examples: `ontouml` if the ontology was designed only using OntoUML stereotypes; `ufo` if the ontology was developed by extending UFO concepts.

oneOf.descriptions:
An object listing URLs of related resources to the documented ontology.

Examples: "github": `"https://github.com/unibz-core/UFO-S"`.
